answers.answer: sounds like you have an arthritic joint to the great toe area.  the other pain is probably resulting from offloading the foot and applying increased pressure to the other joints.cortisone injections and supportive shoes help.  if you continue to have pain, get an xray done.  you may need a surgical procedure to decompress the joints.

question: For the last several months been having pain in my feet.  Im a 51 yr.old female with no diabetes just high blood pressure. .well controlled.  The pain started in my right foot mostly at the base of the big toe in the joint. No redness or swelling. Then it sort of went across the top of my foot at the base of toes.  I cant position either foot to the side as theres pain with that too along the outside of foot. Just to hit these certain areas especially the big toe sends me thru the roof.  It doesnt seem to bother when I wear shoes.  Mornings are extremely painful upon standing, very hard to walk for the first 10 minutes. any ideas as to what this is?   Came on all of a sudden.  Thank you.
title: pain in feet
